generals.title: Primer to Climate Scenarios
generals.description: This interactive primer give an introduction to climate change scenarios are and how they are connected to socioeconomics, energy & land use, emissions, climate change and climate impacts.
generals.keywords: projection pathway ssp socioeconomic emissions concentration climate change impact mitigation adaptation integrated iam integrated assessment model
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Global Stocktake II
generals.description: The second Stocktake module starts where the first one ended. It guides the reader from the global Stocktake to the local.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Towards an electric future
generals.description: We cannot predict the future, but we can create different plausible scenarios of how a future decarbonization pathway could look like. In this module you will be introduced to the concept of Electrification and to the broad strategy to go Carbon Neutral by reducing emissions.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: National and sectoral transition paths II
generals.description: If we implement strong mitigation strategies where is our future energy coming from? This module will guide you through possible energy scenarios, giving you the possibility to explore one year of energy demand in the future.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: What is the potential impact of the demand side?
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Land Use
generals.description: Today, most of the global ice-free land is used by humans in some way or another. Land use change and sustainable land management play an important role in climate change adaptation and mitigation. But they also have an impact on food security, desertification, land degradation.
generals.keywords: population income calorie crop demand fish livestock supply chain food rice meat cereals rangelands cropland forest urban sugar nitrogen
generals.subtitle: Work in Progress – Learn module

generals.title: Senses Earth
generals.description: Discover how the world will be affected by extreme events at different global warming levels.
generals.subtitle: Explore module

generals.title: Investment Opportunities and Alignment
generals.description: What are near-time investment requirements for meeting stringent climate targets in a low carbon world?
generals.subtitle: Work in Progress – Learn module

generals.title: Fossil Fuels Risks
generals.description: Discover finance risks related to transitions in a variety of sectors including: Fossil fuels, End User and Power
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Primary Energy Scenarios
generals.description: Learn about the concept of primary energy sources like coal, oil and solar radiation. This module explains conversion processes and scenarios in the SSP worlds.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Scenario Finder
generals.description: This explore module allows you to quickly filter all avialable scenarios from the IAMC 1.5 database
generals.subtitle: Explore module

generals.title: Co-production Techniques Finder
generals.description: How can we do co-production? The co-production database provides an overview of different methods and tools for specific co-production objectives.
generals.subtitle: Explore module

generals.title: Climate risks Finder
generals.description: How can we interpret scenarios for risk assesments? The risk finder provides an overview of direct and indirect risks of climate change.
generals.subtitle: Explore module

generals.title: Global Stocktake
generals.description: This general explores how current decarbonization plans until 2030 relate to the long-term targets of the Paris Agreement.
generals.keywords: decarbonization plan paris agreement target emission gap carbon budget temperature stranded assets land use investment cost-effective policies policy mitigation technology cdr carbon dioxide removal short term long bridge scenario
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Physical Risks
generals.description: What are the financial risks of climate change impacts? This module demontrates market impacts of extreme events across multiple degrees of global warming.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Co-producing adaptation strategies
generals.description: We can explore what could happen, but how do we deal with the concequences of these scenarios; how do we adapt? The step-by-step module guides you towards robus adaptation by the use of scenario's and co-production techniques. The detailed steps provide examples and on how to make you own adaptation strategy.
generals.subtitle: Learn module

generals.title: Scenario Explorer
generals.description: This Scenario Explorer presents an ensemble of quantitative, model-based climate change mitigation pathways.
generals.subtitle: Database

generals.title: A Brief History Of CO2 Emissions
generals.description: Greenhouse gas emissions are one of the driving forces behind climate change. In our short film “A Brief History of CO2 Emissions”, we visualize the geographic distribution and the historic dimension of carbon dioxide emissions.
generals.subtitle: Learn film

generals.title: Extreme Events
generals.description: Climate change makes extreme events more frequent and more intense. Learn how both people and land will be affected by crop failures, river floods, tropical cyclones, heatwaves, wildfires, and droughts in the future.
generals.subtitle: Work in Progress – Learn module
